t: Titus 1
Paul,*p a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God's elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;
In*p hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;
But*p hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;
To*p Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.
For*p this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:
If*p any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.
For*p a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;
But*p a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;
Holding*p fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.
For*p there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:
Whose*p mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre's sake.
One*p of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretans are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.
This*p witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;
Not*p giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.
Unto*p the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.
They*p profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
Titus 2
But*p speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:
That*p the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience.
The*p aged women likewise, that they be in behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;
That*p they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,
To*p be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.
Young*p men likewise exhort to be sober minded.
In*p all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine shewing uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,
Sound*p speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.
Exhort*p servants to be obedient unto their own masters, and to please them well in all things; not answering again;
Not*p purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.
For*p the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,
Teaching*p us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;
Looking*p for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;
Who*p gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.
These*p things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.
Titus 3
Put*p them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,
To*p speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.
For*p we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.
But*p after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,
Not*p by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;
Which*p he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;
That*p being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

This*p is a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.
But*p avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.
A*p man that is an heretic after the first and second admonition reject;
Knowing*p that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.
When*p I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.
Bring*p Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.
And*p let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.
All*p that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
